overview: “It is a very courageous work, developing (it seems to me) out of the radical cut-up aesthetic of Brion Gysin (especially Gysin's painting/visual art) and William S. Burroughs. Because [Swanton’s] thinking seems to have some affinity for Gysin's visual art, he has extended the technique of the cut up not in the direction of Anthony Balch (however interesting works like The Cut-Ups and Ghost at n°9 (Paris) might be,) but in the more radical direction of Letterism (Lettrisme) [...] This is a very daring work, and very, very strong.” - R. Bruce Elder
title: FLASHOVER
